09 May 2014
git commit

  1. stage all modified and deleted paths

    --all

  2. allow recording an empty commit

    --allow-empty

  3. allow recording a commit with an empty message

    --allow-empty-message

  4. amend the tip of the current branch

    --amend

  5. override the author name used in the commit

    --author

  6. specify how the commit message should be cleaned up

    --cleanup

  7. override the author date used in the commit

    --date

  8. only show list of paths that are to be commited or not, and any untracked

    --dry-run

  9. edit the commit message before committing

    --edit

  10. read commit message from given file

    --file

  11. update the given files and commit the whole index

    --include

  12. interactively update paths in the index file

    --interactive

  13. use the given message as the commit message

    --message

  14. do not include the output of git status in the commit message template

    --no-status

  15. do not look for suspicious lines the commit introduces

    --no-verify

  16. separate dry run entry output with NUL

    --null

  17. commit only the given files

    --only

  18. output dry run in porcelain-ready format

    --porcelain

  19. suppress commit summary message

    --quiet

  20. use existing commit object and edit log message

    --reedit-message

  21. use existing commit object with same log message

    --reuse-message

  22. output dry run in short format

    --short

  23. add Signed-off-by line at the end of the commit message

    --signoff

  24. include the output of git status in the commit message template

    --status

  25. use file as a template commit message

    --template

  26. show files in untracked directories

    --untracked-files

  27. show unified diff of all file changes

    --verbose

Til next time,
at 15:11
